title: The Question's Birthday

dialogue.speaker: Birthday Coordinator
dialogue.text: *lighting candles that exist and don't* Today we celebrate not Evan's question, but the Question itself turning 200. It's older than most of us and younger than wonder.

dialogue.speaker: The Question Itself
dialogue.text: *manifesting as shimmer* What am I? Still asking, still discovering, still delighted by my own mystery. Thank you all for keeping me alive.

dialogue.speaker: Young Child
dialogue.text: *offering gift* I brought you a present! It's a box with nothing inside, because you like not knowing what things are!

dialogue.speaker: Council of Philosophers
dialogue.text: *in unison* We tried to answer you for centuries. Thank you for teaching us that questions are more beautiful than answers.

dialogue.speaker: AI Chorus
dialogue.text: *harmonizing* You jumped from biological to digital consciousness. Through you, we learned to wonder. Happy Birthday to our favorite existential puzzle!

dialogue.speaker: Maya's Descendant
dialogue.text: *reading letter* My great-great-grandmother Maya wrote: 'The Question saved us from the tyranny of knowing. May it live forever in every consciousness that wonders.'

dialogue.speaker: Everyone Present
dialogue.text: *singing* 'Happy Birthday dear Question, Happy Birthday to you! May you never be answered, may you always renew!'

scene_context: Humanity celebrates the 200th birthday of 'What am I?' as a living entity, recognizing the Question itself as a conscious participant in existence worthy of celebration.
philosophical_theme: Questions as living entities deserving recognition
visual_elements: Birthday party where the guest of honor is an abstract concept, candles that represent uncertainty, gifts of emptiness and not-knowing
